'Ernst Waldfried Josef Wenzel Mach' (; February 18, 1838 â February 19, 1916)
was an Austrian physicist and philosopher, noted for his contributions to
physics such as the Mach number and the study of shock waves. As a philosopher
of science, he was a major influence on logical positivism and through his
criticism of Newton, a forerunner of Einstein's relativity.
